title: Designing Pre-Clinical Curricula for Medical Schools: Utilizing Self-Directed Learning Guides (SLG)

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Learners assume administrator/leader roles with intermediate science domain expertise, provided with digital devices (laptops/tablets), emphasizing continuous feedback via formative assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain core medical concepts at over 80% accuracy within a week by utilizing multimedia materials (videos, texts, images) provided through SLG.
Learners achieve a 90% participation rate in Team-Based Learning (TBL) based on SLG content and actively contribute to at least three case analysis discussions.
Learners rate their preference for content organization (structure, visual elements, information density) at 4 or above on a 5-point scale through self-assessment surveys using SLG.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
